page.title: 15Manor House,Ayot St.Lawrence
page.content: {INTERESTING HOUSES IN AYOT ST. {LAWRENCE THE MANOR HOUSE was built in Tudor times. In the reign of Henry the 8th it was owned by Sir Richard Parr, whose daughter, Catherine, was Henry's 6th wife. Henry is supposed to have courted Catherine, after locking his then wife, Anne Boleyn, up in a dark room in the roof! Anne Boleyn's ghost is supposed to haunt the Manor, but the present occupants have not seen it. A hat of Henry's and a pair of shoes belonging to Anne were left in the house.The house now has a 17th C. facade. At one time it was turned into two cottages where the estate's butler and gamekeeper lived, called Stag and Hind!
